page.title: 14'GROWING - GOING - GONE' !
page.content: S.W.Corner:500080.A wide band of cultivated grss land sandwiched between wheatfields in the north and oil-seed-rape in the south.The S.W - N.E. by-road on the eastern side forms the heart of the village of Magdalen Laver,a straggling settlement of houses,farms and a nursery.The nursery greenhouses in use are of the modern wide-span variety using an oil-fired ducted air heating system.The stock is exclusively foliage plants for indoor display.The older steam-heated units hve been allowed to fall into decay;a mute reminder of changing market pressures & the pursuit of efficiency.The village school has also succumbed to the issue of economic viability.The school is now a private residence and the children now receive their primary education in the villg of Moreton 3-4 miles east.
